title: Famiglia Cielo 2016 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)
description: This simple white opens with aromas of honeysuckle and pear while the easygoing palate offers hints of nectarine and green apple. Fresh acidity gives it a brisk finish. Drink soon.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Le Temps des Vendanges Malbec-Merlot (Comté Tolosan)
description: This is an easygoing fruity wine. It has soft tannins and bright juicy red fruits. The structure is just right to give the wine its shape along with the acidity and generous aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Noble Hill 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Simonsberg-Paarl)
description: Soft hints of peach, verbena and peony grace the delicate nose of this lightweight white. Touches of green banana and pear flesh out the palate, while ample acidity keeps the mouthfeel fresh through the finish. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Brut Nature Reserva Arinto Sparkling (Tejo)
description: This yeasty wine is bone-dry, mature and ready to drink, a toasty element having replaced any fruitiness. The aftertaste is crisp and bright.

title: Robertson Winery 2015 Chardonnay (Robertson)
description: A lovely flinty character graces the yellow apple, peach and orange cream aromas on the nose of this friendly wine. It's quite round and mouthfilling, with a prevailing smoky flavor on the palate that's reminiscent of baked apple with bacon crumble. Drink now.

title: The Seeker 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Raspy berry and plum aromas lead to a palate dominated by tartaric acid. That, in turn, leads to sharp berry and plum flavors backed by a bracing finish.

title: Vino San Esteban 2015 Réserve Malbec (Comté Tolosan)
description: A French version of a brand that is more familiar in Chile as Viña San Esteban, this wine has more stylistically to do with South America than southwest France. It is soft, juicy, rounded and with attractive ripe tannins. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Schooler Nolan 2014 Weldon's Wine Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas of vanilla and wood spice lead to elegant, somewhat dried out and dilute fruit flavors, followed by a short finish.

title: Tinazzi 2015 Cà de' Rocchi  (Soave)
description: This informal white opens with whiffs of orchard fruit and citrus while the simple palate offers suggestions of pear and pineapple. A hint of bitter almond marks the rather lean abrupt finish.

title: Carmel 2014 Admon Vineyard Chardonnay (Galilee)
description: A clean nose of citrus paves the way for flavors of grapefruit and Sevilla orange. This wine is soft and pleasing on the palate, but it may be touch tart for some tastes.

title: Bouchard Finlayson 2014 Crocodile's Lair Kaaimansgat Chardonnay (Overberg)
description: This is soft and accessible now, with plush notes of baked apple, creamed pear and oaky spice on the attack. The medium-weight palate is broad in feel, begging for a bit more lift to the rich fruit and buttered toast flavors. Drink now.

title: Cruzat NV Cruzat Brut Rosé Méthodo Tradicional Sparkling (Valle de Uco)
description: This Pinot Noir-heavy sparkler opens with aromas of briny citrus and bready yeast. The palate is fresh and low on weight, with a dominating flavor of pink grapefruit. Overall, this is basic but easy to drink.

title: Cave de Tain 2015 Nobles Rives Marsanne (Collines Rhôdaniennes)
description: Round and pillowy in feel, this is a simple wine, offering modest melon and pineapple fruit. Drink it over the next few months.

title: Charles Krug 2013 Limited Release X Clones Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This dense, rich and ripe varietal Cabernet Sauvignon is aged in new French oak for 19 months. It shows smoked meat and bacon flavors that last into the finish.

title: Château Bélingard 2015 Bélingard  (Bergerac Rosé)
description: This pale rosé blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is fruity with crisp strawberry fruits and acidity. It has a soft perfumed aftertaste that makes it immediately attractive. Drink now.

title: Adega de Cantanhede NV Blanc de Blancs Bruto Sparkling (Beira Atlantico)
description: This is a soft, creamy wine with fruitiness and a yeasty edge. Made from Bical, Arinto and Maria Gomes, it's ready to drink.

title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: This widely available white is unfussy and medium bodied, with toasted oak and baked apple flavors, brightened by a squeeze of lemon.

title: Alves de Sousa 2014 Caldas Red (Douro)
description: A typical Douro blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barroca, this wine is all about bright, crisp fruit. Black and red currant flavors come with tight acidity and a juicy character. Tightly wound now, it needs a few more months to calm down. Drink from 2018.

title: Famiglia Cielo 2014 Pinot Nero (Delle Venezie)
description: This informal red has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of black-skinned fruit and a suggestion of cooking spice. The simple palate delivers black cherry and vanilla alongside laid-back tannins. Drink soon.

title: Martinez & Martinez 2013 Cesar Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: The aromas of vanilla, herb and cherry show some volatility. The cherry flavors are light, finishing tart.

title: Paradiso di Frassina 2011 Flauto Magico Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of espresso, grilled herb, scorched underbrush and French oak. The lean evolved palate shows roasted coffee bean, a hint of oak-driven spice and a salty note but the fruit has already dried up, leaving an abrupt, astringent finish.

title: Vergelegen 2014 Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)
description: Surprisingly shy and reserved in nature, this offers subtle aromas and flavors of apple core and spiced orange peel. Soft and accessible, it's direct and clean, yet short on the finish. Drink now.

title: Vin Vault NV Chardonnay (California)
description: Buttery aromas and buttery, spicy flavors lend an outgoing personality to this medium-bodied wine. Vanilla and cream flavors add some interest, while the texture is broad and smooth.

title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Chardonnay (Thracian Valley)
description: This straw-colored Chardonnay has aromas of apple and citrus blossom with flavors of creamy apple, vanilla and citrus pith. It has nice weight on the palate with a clean acidic finish.

title: The Naked Grape NV Merlot (California)
description: This is bold for a boxed wine, showing ripe, lightly spicy flavors supported by a firm and moderately tannic texture. It's nearly dry, too.

title: Treleaven 2015 Tracie's Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Cayuga Lake)
description: Hints of nut and spice on the nose lift flatter tones of pressed apple and pear in the palate of this medium-bodied white. Soft lemonade acidity brightens the finish.

title: Ochoa 2015 Vendimia Tardia Single Vineyard Moscatel (Navarra)
description: Pine notes and an aroma akin to floor polish make for an iffy start. This carries a slight chemical flavor as it moves along, while honey and brown-sugar notes sweeten things up. A chunky, obtuse finish feels sticky due to mild acidity.

title: Ogier 2015 Héritages White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: This is a plump, broad southern Rhône white, offering subtle notes of melon, pear and wet stones. Drink it before the end of 2017 while it still retains some freshness.

title: Laberinto 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Dusty, generic plum and berry aromas are highly regular. This Malbec is chunky in feel, without much precision. Oaky buttery slightly greasy berry flavors finish hot and creamy, with little to no elegance or cut.

title: Zorzal 2014 Eggo Tinta de Tiza Red (Tupungato)
description: Narrow berry aromas are angular and punchy. This feels high in acidity, with hard tannins. That sharp acidity makes for tart unyielding black plum flavors.
